channel.title: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?
channel.description: The farthest i've heard you can do without surgical treatment is cauterize the wound yourself, but can you health naturally?

item.title: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:23, topic:434593”][quote author=STH link=topic=537309.msg3929188#msg3929188 date=1330519468]
I remember a story about a dude in a dual a long time ago that dueled naked because most of the infections that killed people came from the dirty clothes they were wearing.

Might be true, might be not.
[/quote]

It was mainly the shape and the speed of the bullet that caused clothes to enter the gunshot wound.[/quote]

That makes sense, like a hollow-point bullet would grab clothes where a full metal jacket might not.

Read full topic
item.source: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?

item.title: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“STH, post:20, topic:434593”]I remember a story about a dude in a dual a long time ago that dueled naked because most of the infections that killed people came from the dirty clothes they were wearing.

Might be true, might be not.[/quote]

It was mainly the shape and the speed of the bullet that caused clothes to enter the gunshot wound.

Read full topic
item.source: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?

item.title: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

this reminds me of a time when I was a kid, I was in a car accident and a bunch of glass went into my face most of it was removed but a few years later I had what I though to be a pimple on my forehead upon popping it a small piece of glass came out.

Yup, I think you hear these sorts of stories most from prison doctors (as statistically there’s probably more people in prison with gun shot wounds than a normal doctor would ever see) because some fragments of bullets make their way to the surface of the skin gradually over time, although I think most stay put.

Read full topic
item.source: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?

item.title: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:13, topic:434593”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=537309.msg3928837#msg3928837 date=1330478414]
I’m sure you can, how do you think people did it hundreds of years ago?

You basically have two choices, depending on the severity of the wound, you either heal, or you die.
[/quote]
well back then amputations were the shit[/quote]

Is it possible to amputate a torso?

Read full topic

item.source: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?

item.title: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Your body will surround bullet fragments with connective tissue and just wall them in afaik. I doubt the bullet will pickup any fragments of clothes, but infection is certainly more dangerous than the bullet wound itself (if you managed to stop the bleeding and it dodged vital organs).

Read full topic
item.source: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?

item.title: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Maybe the bullet itself won’t do much harm (probably depends on the material the bullet is made of), but if it lodges some bits of your clothes inside of your body it can get infected. I guess you can heal a through and through wound naturally, but it might leave permanent damage depending on the body part that was hit.

Read full topic
item.source: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?

item.title: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

You can (most of the time) leave the bullet in if it hasn’t buried itself in anything massively important, so in these cases I imagine the main thing is to stop the bleeding, which is easier to do with a bullet wound than the gaping hole a sword or spear would leave.

Bare in mind before guns our weapons were far more brutal and people survived all kinds of injuries. We might be bags of flesh but we’re tougher than we look.

EDIT:Although if you get shot in the stomach you’re probably dead.

Read full topic
item.source: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?

item.title: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:14, topic:434593”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=537309.msg3928837#msg3928837 date=1330478414]
I’m sure you can, how do you think people did it hundreds of years ago?
[/quote]

Uh, we had medicine before guns :P[/quote]

People in the middle of nowhere in the 1600s through 1800s didn’t have medicine, but they usually had guns.

Read full topic

item.title: Can you heal from a gunshot wound naturally?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:7, topic:434593”] 2am this morning I was in a gas station and 3 guys jumped me in the back, I knocked out all 3 (skinny white trash) of them and as I ran out the first one I knocked out got up and shot me as I was leaving. I was shot right above my right hip and it came out right near my belly button, but it was only a .22 round from the look. I made it to my car and made it home and I haven’t passed out or anything. Of course im kidding i just watched a movie and was curious, who do you think I am? Ollie?

:[/quote]
ouch at the Ollie comment. who knows, it could have been a hunting accident

Read full topic
